headline: D.R. Horton reports 24% net income drop amid homebuyer incentives
summary: D.R. Horton’s Paul Romanowski (Getty, D.R. Horton)The nation’s largest homebuilder reported $1 billion in net income in the quarter ending June 30, a 24 percent decline from the same period last year, when the company reported a net income of $1.4 billion. Its home sales gross margin shrank year over year, due in large part to homebuyer incentives. D.R. Horton reported $1.9 billion in gross profit in the quarter, a sequential increase from $1.6 billion in the previous quarter but a year-over-yea

headline: Lennar and Toll Brothers Shares Are Soaring, What You Need To Know
summary: A number of stocks jumped in the afternoon session after peer, D.R. Horton reported strong quarterly results. The positive sentiment lifted the entire homebuilding sector after D.R. Horton, delivered strong third-quarter results that surpassed analyst expectations. This news appeared to overshadow broader concerns about the housing market, which included reports of stubbornly high mortgage rates and a potential slowdown.

headline: Homebuilder stocks, Coca-Cola earnings, Kohl's stock skyrockets
summary: Here are some of today's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in the latest Market Minute. Homebuilder stocks are rising following earnings results from DR Horton (DHI) and PulteGroup (PHM). Coca-Cola's (KO) Q2 results topped Wall Street estimates. The company announced that it will offer drinks made with cane sugar instead of high fructose corn syrup. Kohl's (KSS) shares are soaring thanks to retail traders who are hyping up the stock's performance. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

content.title: Homebuilder stocks, Coca-Cola earnings, Kohl's stock skyrockets
content.description:
Here are some of today's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in the latest Market Minute.

Homebuilder stocks are rising following earnings results from DR Horton (DHI) and PulteGroup (PHM).

Coca-Cola's (KO) Q2 results topped Wall Street estimates. The company announced that it will offer drinks made with cane sugar instead of high fructose corn syrup.

Kohl's (KSS) shares are soaring thanks to retail traders who are hyping up the stock's performance.

Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: D.R. Horton (DHI) Shares Skyrocket, What You Need To Know
summary: Shares of homebuilder D.R. Horton (NYSE:DHI) jumped 14% in the morning session after the company reported fiscal third-quarter results that surpassed Wall Street's expectations. The nation's largest homebuilder announced earnings of $3.36 per share on revenue of $9.23 billion. These figures comfortably beat the consensus analyst estimates, which called for earnings of approximately $2.90 per share and revenue of $8.78 billion. Although total revenue and net income declined year-over-year, invest

headline: Lockheed Martin, AstraZeneca, DR Horton: Trending Tickers
summary: Lockheed Martin (LMT) reported second quarter results, showing that sales came in below estimates and operating profit plunged by 60%. The company also cut its full-year guidance. AstraZeneca (AZN) will invest $50 billion in US manufacturing by the end of the decade. DR Horton (DHI) reported strong third quarter results, with revenue topping estimates. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here.

headline: D.R. Horton’s (NYSE:DHI) Q2 Sales Top Estimates, Stock Soars
summary: Homebuilder D.R. Horton (NYSE:DHI) beat Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q2 CY2025, but sales fell by 7.4% year on year to $9.23 billion. The company expects the full year’s revenue to be around $33.95 billion, close to analysts’ estimates. Its GAAP profit of $3.36 per share was 16.6% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

content.title: D.R. Horton’s (NYSE:DHI) Q2 Sales Top Estimates, Stock Soars

The company expects the full year’s revenue to be around $33.95 billion, close to analysts’ estimates. Its GAAP profit of $3.36 per share was 16.6% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: D.R. Horton third-quarter results beat estimates on incentives push
summary: D.R. Horton reported third-quarter profit and revenue above estimates on Tuesday as buyer incentives sustained home sales amid high interest rates and rising costs, sending shares of the homebuilder up more than 12% in morning trading. The sector is grappling with weakening consumer sentiment, prompting builders to offer incentives such as mortgage rate buydowns and smaller, more affordable homes to stimulate demand. CEO Paul J. Romanowski noted continued impact on new home demand amid ongoing affordability constraints and cautious consumer sentiment.

content.title: D.R. Horton third-quarter results beat estimates on incentives push
content.summary: D.R. Horton reported third-quarter profit and revenue above estimates on Tuesday as buyer incentives sustained home sales amid high interest rates and rising costs, sending shares of the homebuilder up more than 12% in morning trading. The sector is grappling with weakening consumer sentiment, prompting builders to offer incentives such as mortgage rate buydowns and smaller, more affordable homes to stimulate demand. CEO Paul J. Romanowski noted continued impact on new home demand amid ongoing affordability constraints and cautious consumer sentiment.
